events.title: First Microprocessor - Intel 4004
events.description: Intel released the 4004, the world's first commercially available microprocessor. This 4-bit processor contained 2,300 transistors and could perform 60,000 operations per second, laying the foundation for modern computing.

events.title: Introduction of the First Personal Computer
events.description: The Apple II, Commodore PET, and TRS-80 were released, marking the beginning of the personal computer revolution. These machines brought computing power to individual users for the first time.

events.title: IBM PC Launch
events.description: IBM introduced the IBM PC, establishing the standard architecture for decades to come. The open architecture allowed third-party manufacturers to create compatible hardware and software.
